Summary: We will never stay at this location again and will not recommend to family or friends because of what transpired the day we checked out. We are disappointed with the lack of resolution and communication from the General Manager and the Restaurant Manager in regards to our “misplaced” credit card from the restaurant. As we were checking out, my husband went to the cafe to purchase a coffee, he quickly realized that he left his credit card in the restaurant the night before. The front desk staff contacted one of the employees working that night and they CONFIRMED they had our credit card. A few staff members attempted to see if they could find it over at the bar, with no luck. They reassured us that they would call when the restaurant staff got in around 2pm, but this did not
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize for a dissatisfactory experience at our restaurant lounge and apologize our team fell short on service during your visit.  Your restaurant bill was previously refunded in full.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel for Business or Pleasure
Summary: I recently stayed in a 2 queen corner scenic room. The view was awesome and the room was very clean. The hotel still smelled like paint and new carpet/etc. The decor of the hotel/room was super modern and welcoming.  Most of the amenities were not yet open, like the pool and restaurant, but they looked like they were going to be very nice once everything is completed. This will be a great hotel for business travelers and probably for leisure travelers going to Disneyland/etc.  PROS: - Excellent staff - from the front desk folks to the valet, all staff were attentive and very courteous. KUDOS to them! - Hotel is super convenient to 5 Freeway and also all other major routes in Anaheim. - Rooms and public areas are still very new, so everything is very clean and tidy. Felt very
Room tip: Room 655 has view of Matterhorn and Disneyland Fireworks probably once they restart.

Summary: The room and staff were nice but it is right up against the freeway and lone got any sleep.  After checking out we were waiting for the valet so I walked back inside to get a coffee. I was told I could not use card or cash and it was room charge only. Very inconvenient.
Manager Response: We apologize your stay with us was less than satisfactory and sincerely appreciate your honest feedback as we always value all guest feedback and always strive to make improvements where needed.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: In prior visits to Disneyland, we'd stay at the Fairfield Inn, but the Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim is far superior in every way. This is not your usual basic Garden Inn. This is almost full service with bar, room service, and a great gym (by hotel standards). Great staff who provided excellent service as well. It was only a half mile walk to Disneyland entrance.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review of the Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim Resort.  We are excited to hear you enjoyed our full service amenities offered and our convenient location in close proximity to the Disney theme parks.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Room was fine, 2 Queen Beds, a mini-fridge & small microwave.  But the highway noise was a major problem. The front desk has complimentary ear plugs, but you have to ask for them. Housekeeping is currently not offered so each day you call to request any supplies you need. Staff was friendly & helpful, room was clean and the walk to Disneyland was manageable.  As a gold hhonors I did get $20/day food/beverage credit however the prices in the cafe are steep. There are better & quieter choices in the area.
Room tip: Request a room away from the highway
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning our clean guestrooms and our friendly staff.  We are sorry for any dissatisfaction with hotel value and outside noise and appreciate your honest feedback as we always strive to make improvements where needed.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: For a new property, this was disappointing.  VALET PARKING ONLY, and it was slow to respond. Luggage carts not up to the task. Fridge was off upon arrival. Food was good but only accepted room charges. Hope they get their game together in the future.
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize your stay was less than satisfactory and appreciate your valuable feedback, as we always strive to make improvements as needed to the guest experience.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: My wife and I stay 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  Our room was spacious and comfortable.  Wifi worked well.  The gym was large and well equipped.    We had no problems with the valet and getting our car, very responsive.  We had no problems during our stay and would stay here again if we visit Disneyland (only 15-minute walk).  The only concern we had is I am a Gold Hilton Honors Member, and I received $10 per person per day food and beverage allowance.  Based on the prices in the cafe, it was hard to eat breakfast for $10 a day.

We are staying here for our family trip to Disneyland. Our room was clean and comfortable, staff has been very responsive and friendly. My only minor criticism is that the water doesn’t get very hot. We had to run it for quite awhile to get it above lukewarm, and even then it wasn’t hot hot. It is about a 5 minute walk to the main gate with several restaurants within walking distance and about a $10 Uber to the closest Target if you want to stock up on snacks and drinks to take to the park. We are having a great stay, would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you had a great stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim Resort and sincerely appreciate your recommendation to others.  Thank you for sharing your review and thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: A Great Place to Stay for Disneyland
Summary: I booked 3 rooms at the Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim Resort for myself and grown children and grandkids. Everyone found the hotel to be very comfortable, clean, and conveniently located to Disneyland. The staff were great, particularly the restaurant and bar folks.

Summary Heading: Gross sweaty smelly pillows and rude staff did not even care
Summary: It’s only our family’s second day here and we’re already frustrated! Check in with Dana was smooth and nice. We just dropped our stuff in the room and went to disneyland park. After a long tiring day we were expecting nice and comfy beddings, NO, THE PILLOWS SMELLED SWEATY AND HORRIBLE! We called front desk and unfortunately the person named Franky could have cared less! I don't even know if Franky was his real name because he paused when I asked. He was rude! HE LITERALLY TOLD US TO BRING THE 3 SWEATY PILLOWS DOWNSTAIRS TO HIM because he can’t bring the new pillows upstairs. My husband came back in the room with pillows without covers on them! I was literally shock and frustrated with his service. We have not even lie down in the bed yet so whoever slept before us sweat the

Hotel Great! Great location, comfortable and kind staff!! Mary at the front desk was really nice and efficient accommodating all our needs for a very good experience! Valet service is pricy at $30/day, that’s the only side down. But definitely a great place to stay if you plan to visit Disney. 10min walk distance!!

Summary Heading: Our stay in Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim Resort
Summary: The Check-in process in this 3 stars hotel was fast and no upgrade was given to Diamond member The room was good in size, new furniture, bathroom was ok and very comfortable beds  Breakfast options were scarce no point in taking bed and breakfast rate also there is no room service nor housekeeping unless you request it The swimming pool was good in size and the jacuzzi was relaxing  The gym is located on the 2nd floor  No self-parking is available, also valet parking takes a long time so either hire more employees or let the visitors self-park!  The laundromat was well equipped with 4 washing machines and 4 dryers which are sufficient besides the availability of Laundry services at an affordable cost  In the end, the hotel has the best location to Disney land.  Trip type:
Manager Response: Thank you for your thorough review and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary: We were thankful for the early check-in and had hopes for a great stay, but that was not the case.  First, prices for any food at the property are through the roof and unaffordable.  They only offer housekeeping services every 3 days.  That meant on day two when I asked for more towels and a change of sheets that they simply left a pile of everything on the bed, expecting me to change the sheets!  Isn't that what we stay in a hotel for?  Why in the world was our room so humid?!  It was disgusting.  Everything was damp in the room.  Not a good feeling.  The room was barely cleaed when we arrived.  It clearly wasn't sanitized well when there is still hair in the shower!  Overall customer service was lacking.  Look for a different place to stay.
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize your recent stay was less than satisfactory.  We appreciate your candid feedback as we always take guest feedback seriously and always strive to make improvements where needed.  Thank you for your valuable feedback and thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland trip
Summary: The location of this hotel is great for Disney land and you can even sneak back to have some rest with the kids before returning in the evening.   The staff here are exceptional, helpful and friendly which is great to see. We also had breakfast which was simple but perfect to fuel up before Disney.   The few things which need to be considered are: If you are a light sleeper the noise from the freeway - it didn't bother us, but you may be bothered by it Room only serviced every three days and easy to run out of coffee etc. (It was easy to get sorted by dropping by the front desk). The pool is good but not as good as the Courtyard at Marriott and a few others close by  I would come back here - overall experience is wonderful for the proposition in market.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you found our Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim Resort a great place to stay while visiting the Anaheim Disney Resort area.  We thank you for your honest feedback and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary Heading: Clean facility, but terrible service from checking in to checking out
Summary: I made a reservation with a travel agency and confirmation for the reservation is for home2suite with kitchen and free breakfast. but when I checked in, hilton had reservation under hilton garden inn with no kitchen. Having a kitchen was very important with four children but there was nothing that could be done because home2suite was sold out. The travel agency says they see the reservation under home2suite but hilton sees reservation under hilton garden inn. Even though those two hotels are in same hotel, having a kitchen or not is a big reason we booked home2suite. Both hotel and the travel agency blame each other for this and there was nothing that could be done. Very Disappointed and something needs to be done to clarify which hotel we are booking. I am supposed to get food
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize we fell short on service during your recent visit and that you did not receive the room type booked.  If you may kindly email additional information in regards to your booking to gm.dualhilton@nmghotels.net as we would like to further research this matter and provide you with any due credits.  Again, we apologize for an unsatisfactory stay and hope to hear from you.

Summary: Don’t eat at the “buffet” it’s overpriced continental breakfast.  Not really a buffet and that is if you find any food. Also, they staff keeps saying more food to come and after 15 minutes only 8 additional pieces of French toast were served for a room full of people.
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize your experience at our breakfast buffet was unsatisfactory and appreciate your candid feedback so we can share this information with our team and make any necessary changes for improvements in this area as needed.  Thank you for your valuable feedback and thank you for choosing to stay with us.

Summary Heading: The Staff of the Manchester Lounge is Racist
Summary: My family and I are Hilton honor members and stay there often. We stayed at this hotel the second weekend of June 2022 for our annual Disneyland trip. We went to the Manchester Lounge to have dinner and the bartender ignored us and refused to help us.  Then a Caucasian woman arrives and he helps her immediately. When we confronted him about it he became irate and extremely rude. He even brought up money in which I work for a Tech Company and my companion is a Scientist! But because we are Black he assumed we were broke. My family were treated horribly at this hotel and I’m never going there again!!!!!
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize for falling short on service during your stay and that your stay was less than satisfactory in any way.  We take all guest feedback seriously and do not tolerate any type of discriminatory behavior from any of our hotel team members.  We appreciate your honest feedback so that we may take the necessary steps to make improvements to our guest experience.  Thank you for staying with us and again, we apologize your recent stay was less than satisfactory.

Summary: Friendly staff at this location. Room was very clean. Housekeeping available every third day or upon request. Front desk staff are familiar with property and made excellent recommendations for dining. Parking fee is per night. Walked to Disneyland Resort, more than 1/2 mile (20 minute walk), have to walk along roadside. I liked the hotel, updated and clean. Downside, walking distance from Disneyland and hotel. Property does have laundry services, able to use card at machine to purchase.

Victor at the front desk provided us a fast and easy check in which=excellent customer service . The staff was very warm and friendly. The hotel is gorgeous super new and clean. I really enjoyed my stay here with my siblings. This is definitely my hotel go to when going to Disneyland. Thank you Hilton Garden team for giving us a good stay!
Manager Response: We are excited to hear the Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim Resort is your new 'go to' hotel for your future Disney visits.  Thank you so much for the wonderful review and for your kind words in regards to our staff and facilities.

Summary: This could be a four star property, but they fail in several areas. First, they fail to follow Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions regarding Gold and Diamond daily F&B credit. Per Hilton terms, you have until checkout to use your final daily credit. This property requires you to use your first credit the day you check in and you cannot use your last credit the day you check out. Checking in late at night? Too bad, you lost your first credit!  Breakfast at this property is much more expensive than other HGI hotels. Most items are $18 plus $4 for coffee, so your $10 Diamond credit doesn’t come close to covering even half of your breakfast.  Lastly, do you want housekeeping? That is going to cost you an extra $12.  While this is a beautiful, new property, it would be my last choice
Manager Response: We sincerely apologize your stay was less than satisfactory in any way and for falling short on service.  We appreciate you sharing these important details and providing your honest feedback as we always aim to improve our guests' experience. The daily My Way credit should be valid for each day of stay as you mentioned and we have since updated our policy.  In regards to housekeeping, we currently offer housekeeping service after the third day of stay, however a limited service or supplies request may be requested in between service at no additional cost. Thank you for being a valued Hilton Honors member and thank you for your valuable feedback.

Summary: This is a great location if you’re going to Disneyland. It’s MAYBE a minute walk, if that. The staff was  helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable!! I will definitely stay here again!!

The hotel is ok. It’s clean. Beds are about average. Pillows below average. Pool hours are well below average - 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.  Price was the best we found in the area at the time. We’d stay here again all things remaining constant. But we’d switch to another hotel in a heartbeat if the prices were closer.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here unless you want to be robbed
Summary: STAY AWAY ROOM BROKEN INTO. We stayed her a few times with no problem. But we were visiting Disneyland for Valentines Day and when we came back to our room after a long day we noticed someone had been in our room and stolen everything of value in our room electronics, jewelry clothing and my medications and insulin I immediately called the front desk and was told there was no manager there and they didn't know we to do we called the police to make a report I requested to change rooms as I didn't feel safe in the room and was told they couldn't move me and that I would need to talk to a manager in the morning I didn't sleep at all worried that someone would break into the room again.  In the morning we talked to a manager and was told they would check the security camera and to

We arrived at noon and were told that no rooms were available yet.  They were kind enough to hold our bags while we went to Disneyland for the day.  This is the first Hilton property that didn’t offer or mention breakfast or the daily food credit. Could the daily food credit not be supported at the Anaheim Hilton Garden Inn? There was no mention of it during check-in or when we picked up our bags that evening to go to our room.  I suggest informing all guests about the food credit at check in whether it’s offered or not.

Summary Heading: The hotel is about 10 minutes from Disney.
Summary: This hotel doesn't have breakfast and you hace to pay for parking. That's the only thing that I didn't like. There's no parking anywhere and it is valet parking only. The room was very clean and confortable.

Stay here! You won’t regret it. About a 10 min walk to Disneyland and very very clean. Great customer service and the supervisor was awesome. We are from Hawaii and felt the ALOHA spirit. Mahalo Nui staff for making our week stay so amazing! We miss it already as we are currently in LV and not getting the same cleanliness or customer service.

Summary Heading: Clean room, walking distance to Disney
Summary: Our room and bathroom was clean. Nice modern furniture. Comfy mattress. Plenty of room to organize things. Internet was fast. The bathroom was a bit small for a room with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed though. The door the bathroom is also a sliding door there’s some gaps when you close it. Walking distance to Disneyland, about 15mins. The only thing we didn’t like was the mandatory valet. It would be better if it was just self-park or reserved parking if they must. Valet staff were nice and quick but the valet system itself made getting our car inconvenient especially when there was a back up. And you also have to account for the expensive parking fees ($30 a day at the time of writing this) + tip for the valet. Parking fees at these Disneyland hotels are getting ridiculous.

The first room that was given we went in and started to unpack. Bathroom had a awful odor as if they had pipe issues. Opened the refrigerator only to find a dirty opened soda bottle from the previous stay. In this pandemic the last thing you want is to feel is that the rooms aren’t being properly maintained and cleaned.   Called and was given another room and that room was better, but still had an odor and the toilet seat had old pee on it. Very gross…  I’ve had great service with the Hiltons, but not this location or the case this time around. Very disappointed this stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us .  I am so sorry to hear about your stay.  While we strive for perfection, we missed the mark this time around.  I want you to know that I have shared your feedback with our Housekeeping Team and together we will do all we can to make sure that this does not happen again.  I hope that we can restore your faith in us and you will give us another chance.  If your travel plans bring you back to Anaheim, please let me know.  Best regards!

Summary: Hotel raised parking prices without notice. Hair and dried conditioner (I hope) in the bathtub. When I checked in online, I chose a room with view of fireworks from Disneyland. When I arrived, staff stated the room wasn’t ready and put me in a different room. Will not stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  We apologize for any confusion regarding our parking rates.  We do charge a $30 parking fee for the 1st vehicle and $40 for each additional vehicle.  While some of our rooms may have a partial view of fireworks, we do not guarantee view types.  Fireworks can be discontinued at any time, can be seasonal, and weather can also affect views.  Please see our Front Desk for suggestions on the best locations to view fireworks.  Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to have you back again in the future.

Summary: This was our first time staying at this property for Disneyland. Everything was great from the moment we checked in and the day we left. The cafe in the lobby is very convenient. Staff and the quality of the room was all so great!

Summary Heading: My worst experience on a Hilton hotel
Summary: If you have a oversized van good luck to you you’re on your own. They don’t have a solution for you. That’s why I would not recommend this hotel imagine you came a from a long trip and then you have to park your van somewhere else and your not familiar with the place.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We apologize for the challenges that you experienced with our parking.  At our hotel, we only offer valet parking and all vehicles are parked in our under ground storage.  Due to this situation, there limitations to the types of vehicles that can be parked.  If you are ever unsure, please contact the hotel directly for more information.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay and had a wonderful time. Hotel was clean and staff was friendly. Just fyi it’s a 20 minute walk to Disneyland. Can’t cut through any buildings and take a shortcut you have to follow the pathway

From the minute we walked into the lobby we felt welcomed. Nice clean, quiet room. Just a 5 minute walk to Disneyland. Front counter personnel were knowledgeable regarding the park and they had great personalities.

The place is amazing. Amazing staff, clean facility, like new, quiet and very close walk to Disneyland. Our room was great for the stay and we really appreciated the place. It had a great laundry room and valet parking that made everything easy. We will gladly stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel to stay at when going to Disneyland
Summary: This was the perfect hotel to stay when you have a big family. My three kids had room and space to use. The beds were nice and lovely to go to after walking around Disneyland all day. Staff is outstanding

All good aside from the lackluster “welcoming” our first day from the front desk clerk (Sarah?); maybe she was having a bad day.  Clean room, nice lobby, good distance from Disneyland. Valet crew were great and welcoming.

Summary Heading: Horrible customer service. Not very clean
Summary: There was a dirty sock in the room when we checked in on the floor and one of the queen beds had dirty sheets. They do not service the room unless you stay more than four days which was not told to us when we checked in. Do not stay at this hotel, stay at any other hotel then the Hilton Garden Inn
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are sorry for the challenges that you experienced.  We strive to ensure perfection, but it seems like we let you down.  We will be sure to review your feedback with our team to improve our service and hope that we can make it up to you on a future visit.  Best regards!

Summary: Overall, the hotel was good. Clean and linens were comfortable. On-site restaurant is only open certain days and the cafe didn’t have many options for a late dinner. The hotel is right off freeway so you will hear traffic noise. The hot water in our room did not get very hot. Location was good being about a 15 min walk to Disneyland.

I picked this hotel because it was so close to Disneyland we could walk there and back. I was delighted with how comfortable the beds were and the rooms were very spacious. There was a nice coffee/snack shop in the lobby too!

There is no breakfast. Despite them advertising as such on Google. It is false advertising. Which is a first for us at a Hilton garden inn. When you're excited to do Disneyland, and have to feed a family of 6 with kids, stopping for breakfast on the way to Disneyland is a grade A can of suck. Your day basically just lost an hour of premier park time. TERRIBLE!!! The front desk is like "we have no clue why it says that".......well its because your manager put it on there and its called SCAMMING FOR BUSINESS.

Hotel was very clean as well as the room. Beds were comfortable and even though we faced the freeway, we didn’t hear too much noise. Staff was very friendly no matter who we encountered. Short walk to Disney and convenient walk to a few fast food restaurants. Great hotel and only feedback I have is better coffee at coffee stand.

Nice new hotel perfect for our mini vacation . Walk to Disneyland was short and easy. Very comfortable beds and room was very clean. All hotel personnel was super nice. Would definitely go back and excited to see finished restaurant.

The staff was so nice and helpful. The rooms are pretty much brand new. Very comfortable beds and very clean. It's walking distance to Disneyland so we were able to just park the car and walk all weekend

I went to this hotel, it was good experience but check in process need some simplifications. Guests shouldn’t have to wait if there is any problem with their booking websites. But overall, room was good, free wifi etc.

This hotel is only 5 months old and is right next to Disney Land. It was fun staying in a brand new place! I felt like I was staying in a very upscale and modern hotel! Very green efficient too! Unfortunately free   breakfast is not offered here. The restaurant was still under construction during my stay.

This place is a 7 minute walk to Disney. Nice location. Only down side , room walls are to thin you can hear next door neighbor. Bathtub can be cleaned out better. But overall the stay here was pleasant

Summary Heading: The "2 Queen Beds 1bd Suite" is not a separate bedroom
Summary: I cancelled my reservation after confirming with Hilton who confirmed with the hotel that the "2 Queen Beds 1bd Suite" is not a separate bedroom. They also said that it should be advertised as a junior suite, but it is not. They knew about this problem since July, but did not update their website.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel if you visit Disneyland/Anaheim
Summary: Good if you’re going to DL. Short walking distance. Super clean/new everything. Friendly staff. No bar/ restaurant open during my time of travel - maybe on the next trip. This will definitely be a go-to hotel for me In the future. Hopefully it won’t change much.

Summary Heading: Do not bring your family here
Summary: Website description was false marketing. The room was missing half the furniture. The restaurant wasn’t completed. If Disneyland wasn’t open nor would this hotel. A brand new hotel which makes it worse.

Hotel was beautiful and within walking distance of Disneyland. Staff was great and accommodating , valet parking was very quick and professional as well. Would return and stay again at this hotel next time we come to Disney .

Had a really good experience here. All the staff were welcoming and efficient. Our room was available when we arrived, a couple hours before 3pm. It was very clean and sufficiently spacious. We heard very little noise while we were there (aside from the white noise of freeway traffic). It's nice to have a fridge and microwave. We didn't ask for our room to be cleaned for the 3 nights we were there. Beds were comfy. Bathroom has a barn door, which I don't like--they don't block sounds very well. Valet parking was friendly and fast. Easy 10 minute walk to the gates at Disneyland. I've stayed at several other hotels in the vicinity, and this is my new favorite.

Summary Heading: Great location, bad service, good breakfast
Summary: Great location and very close to Disney. Easy walk. Good Continental breakfast. Got back from a day at Disney and rom wasn’t even touched. Dirty Towels on floor where we left them,  trash not emptied, coffee not restocked… beds not made. Fridge didn’t work so nothing could be kept cold. Called next day to have someone turn down the room. Went to Disney and came back later… still the room wasn’t touched. Had to call again for someone to bring fresh towels and take the trash. Hilton Diamond status gets you warm mini bottles of water and that’s it…

So happy we decided to stay at this beautiful Hilton Garden Inn, a 10 minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland. Hotel was immaculate and the staff outstanding, very accommodating and friendly. Highly recommend for anyone traveling to this area.

Super nice and walking distant to Disneyland and California adventures. We could even see the fireworks from our room. My family and I would stay again!! Easy to get to off the I-5 and feels very safe. CLEAN and very friendly staff!

The staff was great very helpful and friendly. They answered all our needs during our stay. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Our room was large enough for a comfortable stay for our family of five. There was coffee, tea and cocoa available in the room. Hilton hit it out of the park.

While waiting 10 minutes in the lobby for an Uber, hotel security approached me to ask if I was “lost.”  I wasn’t asked if I was a guest at the hotel, or if they could be of assistance.  They were clearly uncomfortable with a Black man walking around the lobby not realized I was merely passing time awaiting my Uber.  If I wasn’t with my children I would have called out the security personnel on this nonsense and probably made a scene.  But I chose to let it go so as to not embarrass him, or myself, and avoid a situation that clearly would have escalated quickly.

We stayed 3 nights and visited Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm while there. Disney is an easy walk and Knotts is an easy drive. The valets were nice and quick and the only employees we ever interacted with the entire time. You check in online and download your room key to your phone, so we spoke to absolutely no one else. The rooms are very modern and clean. The TV has Directv and the bathroom is equipped with good quality toilet paper!  If you’re on the freeway side of the property be prepared for loud traffic noise all night long. Which is really the biggest downfall for this property.

Everything was fine. Walking distance to a lot of restaurants and Disney. We loved it. Not happy about paying to park my car, but everything else was lovely. Valet and front desk amazing. Everyone greeted you daily.

Summary Heading: Stay at Hilton Garden Inn-Only Good Surprises Await
Summary: We booked at a hotel nearest to Disneyland as was available.  After staying there, this will be the hotel we choose from now on.  The hotel is up to Hilton standards!  Pleasant surprise and all staff were so helpful and friendly!!

Using the Hilton Honors App was so easy, and it allowed us for a hassle-free reservation along with a hassle-free check-in and check-out. The hotel rooms and the beds were clean, very minimal noise, and easy access to the Disneyland Park.

Outstanding customer service! Everyone in this hotel was very nice and helpful.  I will definitely stay here again and refer this hotel to others.  The valet service was very convenient.  They were very nice and helpful with my family’s luggage.  My entire stay was great.  All the staff at the hotel are very nice and i was greeted by all staff and felt sincere like it should.

Overall great property location for Disney trip.  It’s close enough to walk.  And rooms face the Disney fireworks if you don’t stay to see them in the park.  No restaurant.  One elevator working made it inconvenient   No shuttle service either but rooms were clean and comfy

The minute we drove in and walked into the hotel lobby and until our departure day. We were welcomed with a warm and inviting environment. The hotel is beautifully and comfortably designed from the lobby to your rooms. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms pristine shape. I could not ask for a better place to stay while in Anaheim visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: My top choice when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: Short walk to Disney. Multiple food options on the way to the park. Clean. Comfortable. If you’re on the fence….STAY HERE! Didn’t use work out room but did visit it. Great condition and clean. Water fill station inside was perfect!

Not sure why this hotel doesn’t have more stars. It is new and a hidden gem! Close to Disney and the staff is amazing. Especially Jules! Beautiful new hotel. No pool yet, but that wasn’t a big deal for us.

In three nights staying they only clean the rooms at once… nor recommend this place at all and I’ll never stay there again…the communication between a valet ticket girl at the hotel’s driveway the valet parking and the front desk was terrible I had to wait 30 min before I get my room keys

Summary Heading: It was a good hotel, welcoming people !
Summary: It was a nice experience for my family and I! We enjoyed our stay in the room since the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean. The only thing we wished for the trip to be better was being able to access the pool in the actual hotel instead of the other hotel’s pool.

New hotel- easy walking distance to Disneyland- rooms are on the larger size and very comfortable.  Dropped car off at valet and hotel held our luggage until check-in time.  Very friendly snd helpful staff

Facility is beautiful and the room was excellent for a Garden Inn.  Front desk are still learning and were a bit tense to work with as they were not following Hilton Honors procedure and this interaction (with one agent) was unnecessarily tense.  Still working out my billing as I was over charged.  Pool is not open, but more frustrating, the restaurant is closed too and there is no indication of that on the website which is why I picked the Garden Inn as I like their breakfast buffet.  Cafe is open but is double what a Starbucks would cost with no prices listed on the menu.

The facility was under construction. The pool was not completed and the rooms were bare and unfinished. The valet lost my car for period of time and were generally hostile. The staff was sometimes polite but more often aggressively rude. The staff appeared untrained and overwhelmed and ever detail of my stay was affected by this.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and close to Disneyland to walk. Bar and restaurant was not open yet. Parking was a nightmare
Summary: Overall the hotel is clean and the staff was friendly. We paid extra money for a corner room but was not aware that it was going to be right against the five freeway and was super loud all night long. The parking was a nightmare. The valley system did not work. We waited up to 45 minutes at a time to get our car either park or to pick it up to leave. We would not come back unless the parking was fixed.

The hotel is really nice but was very disappointed when they said they did not have a pool. Got to the room, had a powerful awful smell, kind of like a wet dog. Walked back down and checked right out.

Summary Heading: All good until you need your car
Summary: The hotel is nice and new. It’s easy to walk to Disneyland down South Harbor. The staff is helpful and friendly. That’s all that’s good about this place.  The hotel valet service is HORRIBLE. Dropping off a car is a easy. Picking up your car is a nightmare. The valet ticket states “text this number to get your car.” That’s what I did and a while later received a text to try again because no one was available. Meanwhile my family and I are waiting in the lobby seeing other families get their cars. My husband walked up to the valet person with our ticket. Apparently the text service isn’t being utilized right now. (that info would have been helpful earlier) I went up to talk to the very overwhelmed valet person who said that they’d be retrieving our car. After explaining that we

Summary Heading: Beware when booking - there are no 1 bedroom suites!
Summary: Hilton Garden Inn Anaheim Resort is selling rooms that they do not have.  I booked the following on their website: " 2 QUEEN BEDS 1BD SUITE - SEPARATE LIVING AREA-COMP WIFI- HDTV REFRIGERATOR-MICROWAVE- KEURIG COFFEEMAKER".  This Hilton does not have this room type.  Front desk staff confirmed when I checked in that they do not have one bedroom suites with separate living areas.  They said this is a problem with the website.  Fortunately, they allowed me to cancel the reservation.  However, I had to scramble to find another similar option at a different hotel for the night.  After driving all day with family waiting this was not ideal.  I just checked this morning and they are still offering this room type on their website.  They are also charging more for this room.  You will

Take your valuables from your car or the valet staff will steal them. Nothing done when this was brought to the attention of the valet manager. Also housecleaning did not clean until very late in the afternoon

Brand new hotel, within walking distance of Disneyland, great place for staying with family, I would stay they’re again! The service and attention that was given to us was great, they did not have the coffee bar opened yet the pool or restaurant but we did not need one.
